alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Estancia Valley; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Northeast Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 03 at 4:39AM MST until February 03 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch, mainly across the higher elevations. * WHERE...Sangre de Cristo Mountains, Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood, Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Estancia Valley, Central Highlands, and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...Until Noon MST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-40 through Tijeras Canyon and I-25 through Glorieta Pass. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitterly cold temperatures are also expected this morning with low temperatures in the single digits above and below zero, except for the Moreno Valley where temperatures will be in the teens to near 20 below zero. Wind chill values will be even colder.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
